Crimes.Legal_Issue: Whether the Immigration Division had jurisdiction to issue a removal order against Azeem after finding her inadmissible under s. 34(1) of IRPA, given her pending application for ministerial relief under s. 34(2)
Crimes.Governing_Law: Immigration and Refugee Protection Act (IRPA), s. 34(1), s. 34(2), s. 45(d)
Crimes.Procedural_Stage: Judicial review of a removal order issued by the Immigration Division
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: The Federal Court dismissed the application for judicial review
Crimes.Legal_Rule: Under IRPA, s. 34(1) determines inadmissibility on security grounds; s. 34(2) allows ministerial discretion to exempt individuals if their presence is not detrimental to national interest; the Board may issue a removal order under s. 45(d) upon finding inadmissibility
Crimes.Jurisdiction: Immigration Division had jurisdiction to issue the removal order independently of the pending s. 34(2) application
Crimes.Pending_Relief_or_Application: Application for ministerial relief under s. 34(2) of IRPA was pending
Crimes.Applicable_Process: Inadmissibility determination and removal order process under IRPA
Crimes.Remedy_Sought: Certification of an important question and quashing of the removal order
Crimes.Procedural_Issue: Whether the Board must wait for a decision on s. 34(2) before issuing a removal order under s. 34(1)
Crimes.Legal_Framework: IRPA framework for inadmissibility and ministerial relief

Crimes.National_Security_Danger: Risk associated with membership in a designated terrorist organization (MQM)
Crimes.Threat_Assessment: Azeem's membership in MQM posed a threat to national security
Crimes.Nature_of_Acts: Affiliation and involvement with a terrorist organization
Crimes.Admission_or_Involvement: Found to be a member of MQM
Crimes.Individual_Behavior: Participation linked to refugee claim and permanent residence application
Crimes.Nature_of_Membership: Active membership in a terrorist organization
Crimes.Evidence_Type: Documentary and testimonial evidence regarding affiliation with MQM
Crimes.Key_Evidence_Issue: Credibility and weight of evidence linking Azeem to MQM
Crimes.Credibility_Assessment: Immigration Division found sufficient credible evidence of membership
Crimes.Governing_Provision: IRPA s. 34(1) – Inadmissibility on security grounds
Crimes.Decision_Level: Administrative tribunal and federal court review
Crimes.Decision_Outcome: Confirmed inadmissibility due to terrorist organization membership
Crimes.Process: Inadmissibility hearing followed by judicial review
Crimes.Procedural_Fairness_Issue: Claim that process was unfair due to lack of stay pending s. 34(2) relief
Crimes.Detention_Factors: Not applicable – focus on removal, not detention
Crimes.Deportation_Risk: High – removal order issued based on inadmissibility
